      • main

      • calcMinPrice

        public static double calcMinPrice(double basePrice,
                                  int min23Bag,
                                  int min10Bag,
                                  double costPer23,
                                  double costPer10)

        calcMinPrice

        Description: The method calculates the minimum price based on the minimum amount of luggage that is required to cover the needs of the user's estimated baggage weight additional to the base fee provided.

        Preconditions:

        • basePrice should be a double greater than 0.
        • minBag23 and min10Bag should be int greater than 0.
        • costPer23 and costPer10 should be double greater than 0 less than 1.

        Postconditions:

        • The additional cost per bag of 23 kg and 10kg is added to the base price that is provided.
        Parameters:
        basePrice - The base fee for the XS, S or M ticket.
        min23Bag - The minimum number of 23 kg bags needed to cover the baggage weight.
        min10Bag - The minimum number of 10 kg bags needed to cover the baggage weight.
        costPer23 - The unitary cost for every 23 kg bag.
        costPer10 - The unitary cost for every 10kg bag.
        Returns:
        The calculated minimum price.

      • baseRate

        public static double[] baseRate(double xsRate,
                                double sPercent,
                                double mPercent)

        baseRate

        Description: The method calculates the basic fee for the XS, S and M ticket using the XS fee as the base and adding the extra percentage for the fee

        Preconditions:

        • XsRate should be a double greater than 0.
        • sPercent and mPercent should be double greater than 0 less than 1.

        Postconditions:

        • The basic fee for XS, S and M is calculated and saved as a double in an array containing the three prices.
        Parameters:
        xsRate - The minimum fee for the XS ticket
        sPercent - The additional percentage that costs the S ticket compared to the XS ticket
        mPercent - The additional percentage that costs the M ticket compared to the XS ticket
        Returns:
        The most basic price for every ticket type

      • minBagNeeded

        public static int[] minBagNeeded(int weightMatch,
                                 int goalWeight,
                                 int calcCounter)

        minBagNeeded

        Description: The method calculates the minimum amount of bags needed to fullfill the user's estimated luggage weight. It continually loops and continually reduces the max weight given in a ticket type taking into account the difference between the weight estimate and the max weight (to decide whether it will reduce 23 kg or 10kg). If the goal weight is less than 0 (after the included bag weight is is subtracted) then it will save the user needs 0 additional bags and every bag is available for later use. The calc counter is to further loop and do this process on every ticket type (XS, S and M).

        Preconditions:

        • weightMatch should be an int greater than 0. It has to be the maximum weight that the user can carry only in additional luggage (ignoring what the ticket includes).
        • goalWeight should be an int. It can be negative. To use goalWeight, the luggage weight included in a ticker should be subracted from the luggage estimate given by the user. it cannot be greater than the weightMatch.
        • calcCounter should be an int greater than 0 but less or equal to 3. Its used to identify every ticket Type along the calculations. 3 = M, S, XS are available. 2 = M and S are available. 1 = M is available

        Postconditions:

        • The minimum baggage and the left over baggage is saved inside an array. The array also holds --calcounter to afterwards do the same calculatio with other ticker types.
        Parameters:
        weightMatch - The maximum weight that can be held with additional luggage. It will be reduced along the loops.
        goalWeight - The estimated baggage weight given the by the user minus the "free" weight that comes with a ticket type.
        calcCounter - The identifier for the secuential processes to calculate the minBagNeeded for every ticket type.
        Returns:
        An array that holds the minimum bags needed, the ones left after the process and the ticker identifier.

      • bagChoice

        public static int bagChoice(java.util.Scanner sk,
                            int xsSug,
                            int sSug,
                            int mSug,
                            double xsPrice,
                            double sPrice,
                            double mPrice,
                            java.lang.String xsInclude,
                            java.lang.String sInclude,
                            java.lang.String mInclude,
                            int xs23BagMin,
                            int xs10BagMin,
                            int s23BagMin,
                            int s10BagMin,
                            int m23BagMin,
                            int m10BagMin)

        bagChoice

        Description: Taking into consideration which ticket type can cover the users needs, this method will print and available tickets with the information every ticket. After the user decides which ticket he wants, it will save and return the choice for later use.

        Preconditions:

        • sk Should be the name of the available Scanner in Main.
        • xsSug, sSug and mSug should be an int equal to 0 or the Maxweight available to a ticket - minimum weight carried by a ticket (comes "free" with ticket).
        • xsPrice, sPrice and mPrice should be a double that holds the price that is calculated by calcMinPrice(double, int, int, double, double). This takes into consideration the minimum bag needed (minBagNeeded(int, int, int)).
        • xsInclude, sInclude and mInclude should be string the contain the information of what the ticket includes.
        • xs23BagMin, xs10BagMin, s23BagMin, s10BagMin, m23BagMin and m10BagMin should be int greater or equal to 0 that hold how many bags are needed for every ticket to cover the users weight need. This are all calculated by minBagNeeded(int, int, int)

        Postconditions:

        • It displays all the necessary information that the user needs to choose one of the ticket types. Then it will ask for their choice and check if the choise is inside of the available options.
        Parameters:
        sk - The scanner used in main
        xsSug - The weight suggested by the system for XS ticket minBagNeeded(int, int, int)
        sSug - The weight suggested by the system for S ticket minBagNeeded(int, int, int)
        mSug - The weight suggested by the system for M ticket minBagNeeded(int, int, int)
        xsPrice - The minimum price for XS ticket that covers weight needs calcMinPrice(double, int, int, double, double)
        sPrice - The minimum price for S ticket that covers weight needs calcMinPrice(double, int, int, double, double)
        mPrice - The minimum price for M ticket that covers weight needs calcMinPrice(double, int, int, double, double)
        xsInclude - The informatation of everything the XS ticket includes
        sInclude - The information of everything the S ticket includes
        mInclude - The information of everything the M ticket includes
        xs23BagMin - The minimum number of 23kg bag needed to cover users needs with the XS ticket minBagNeeded(int, int, int)
        xs10BagMin - The minimum number of 10kg bag needed to cover users needs with the XS ticket minBagNeeded(int, int, int)
        s23BagMin - The minimum number of 23kg bag needed to cover users needs with the S ticket minBagNeeded(int, int, int)
        s10BagMin - The minimum number of 10kg bag needed to cover users needs with the S ticket minBagNeeded(int, int, int)
        m23BagMin - The minimum number of 23kg bag needed to cover users needs with the M ticketminBagNeeded(int, int, int)
        m10BagMin - The minimum number of 10kg bag needed to cover users needs with the M ticket minBagNeeded(int, int, int)
        Returns:
        shows the selected ticket type by the user. 3 = M, 2 = S, 1 = XS

      • addExtraBags

        public static double addExtraBags(java.util.Scanner sk,
                                  int left10KgBag,
                                  int left23KgBag,
                                  double costPer10Kg,
                                  double costPer23Kg,
                                  double bagLastPrice)

        addExtraBags

        Description: The method will display how many bags the user has left and then ask how many of the 10kg and/or 23kg luggage he wants (if available). Before adding any number of the left bags minBagNeeded(int, int, int) it will make sure that the user actually wants the additional bags or not (yesOrNo(java.util.Scanner, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)). After the number of bags are chosen, each is multiplied by the unitary cost and added. If there aren't any 10kg or 23kg bags left to choose, this process will be skipped and the total price will be unchanged.

        Preconditions:

        • sk Should be the name of the available Scanner in Main.
        • left10kgBag amd left10kgBag should be int greater or equal to 0 that hold how many bags are available after the minBagNeeded(int, int, int) calculations.
        • costPer10Kg and costPer23Kg shoud be a double that holds the unitary price for every 10kg and 23kg bag respectively
        • bagLastPrice should be a double greater than 0 that holds the price of the ticket and minimum luggage requirements calcMinPrice(double, int, int, double, double) .

        Postconditions:

        • It displays all the information to choose if the user wants additional bags and calculates the cost of this additional bags. In case there are no bags available it will skip the step and save 0s.
        Parameters:
        sk - The scanner used in main
        left10KgBag - The number of 10kg bag left after calculating the minimum needed to cover users needs (depends of the ticket type) minBagNeeded(int, int, int)
        left23KgBag - The number of 23kg bag left after calculating the minimum needed to cover users needs (depends of the ticket type) minBagNeeded(int, int, int)
        costPer10Kg - The cost per 10kg bag
        costPer23Kg - The cost per 23kg bag
        bagLastPrice - The cost that takes into account the additionals added by minimum fee, adittional fee per bags, and seat choices
        Returns:
        The total price after adding the additional bags

      • yesOrNo

        public static java.lang.String yesOrNo(java.util.Scanner sk,
                                       java.lang.String textBeforeCheck,
                                       java.lang.String textTryAgain)

        addExtraBags

        Description: The method creates a loop that verifies that the only valid input is "yes" or "no" and the returns the validated input.

        Preconditions:

        • sk Should be the name of the available Scanner in Main.
        • textBeforeCheck A string that contains a "yes" or "no" question .
        • textTryAgain A string that the answer is either "yes" or "no".

        Postconditions:

        • It will save a string the "yes" or "no" after being validated is either of those options
        Parameters:
        sk - The scanner used in main
        textBeforeCheck - Text message that asks the yes or no questio
        textTryAgain - Text message that appears if the input is neither "yes" or "no"
        Returns:
        "yes" or "no" depending on the users choice
